com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.container

Interface WComponentContainer

  • Deprecated. 
    no longer used

    @Deprecated
public interface WComponentContainer
    This interface is used to integrate a container (e.g. WServlet, WPortlet) with a ContainerHelper (e.g. WPortletHelper).
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Martin Shevchenko

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      InterceptorComponent createInterceptorChain(Object nativeRequest)
      Deprecated. 
      The interceptor component returned here is used to wrap the html fragment generated by the UI component.
      WComponent getUI(Object nativeRequest)
      Deprecated. 
      Subclasses may override this method.

    • Method Detail

      • getUI

        WComponent getUI(Object nativeRequest)
        Deprecated. 
        Subclasses may override this method.

        This method will be called internally once per request/response cycle.

        It is up to the subclass to determine the life cycle of the returned component. Should the same instance be returned and shared by all sessions, or should there be a new instance per session.

        A good way to always return the same instance is to use the UIRegistry. E.g. 

           return UIRegistry.getInstance().getUI(KitchenSink.class.getName());
        Parameters:
        nativeRequest - the native request being responded to, for example an HttpServletRequest or PortletRequest.
        Returns:
        the top-level WComponent which defines the UI.

      • createInterceptorChain

        InterceptorComponent createInterceptorChain(Object nativeRequest)
        Deprecated. 
        The interceptor component returned here is used to wrap the html fragment generated by the UI component. Portlets and Servlets need to perform different wrapping of the UI component.
        Parameters:
        nativeRequest - the native request being responded to, for example an HttpServletRequest or PortletRequest.
        Returns:
        the top-level interceptor in the chain.
